title: Jackie Spinner
publication_title: The Modern Series at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body"><iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="480" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cCVVes4vM1Y?rel=0&controls=0" width="853"></iframe>  
Washington Post journalist Jackie Spinner and Fawn Ring, from the Art Institute’s Department of Museum Education, compare World War I, “the war to end wars,” and the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, two of America’s longest military conflicts.</section><section id="figures"> Click here to watch the video. </section>
